Name: ENRGY
Definition: This category includes all GHG emissions arising from combustion and fugitive releases of fuels. Emissions from the non-energy uses of fuels are generally not included here, but reported under the Industrial Processes and Product Use Sector. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Fuel Combustion Activities
Definition: Emissions from the intentional oxidation of materials within an apparatus that is designed to raise heat and provide it either as heat or as mechanical work to a process or for use away from the apparatus. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Energy Industries
Definition: Comprises emissions from fuels combusted by the fuel extraction or energy-producing industries. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Main Activity Electricity and Heat Production
Definition: Sum of emissions from main activity producers of electricity generation, combined heat and power generation, and heat plants. Main activity producers (formerly known as public utilities) are defined as those undertakings whose primary activity is to supply the public. They may be in public or private ownership. Emissions from the own on-site use of fuel should be included. Emissions from autoproducers (undertakings which generate electricity/heat wholly or partly for their own use, as an activity that supports their primary activity) should be assigned to the sector where they were generated and not under 1A1a. Autoproducers may be in public or private ownership. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Electricity Generation
Definition: Comprises emissions from a ll fuel use for electricity generation from main activity producers except those from combined heat and power plants. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Combined Heat and Power Generation (CHP)
Definition: Emissions from production of both heat and electrical power from main activity producers for sale to the public, at a single CHP facility. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Heat Plants
Definition: Production of heat from main activity producers for sale by pipe network. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Petroleum Refining
Definition: All combustion activities supporting the refining of petroleum products, including on-site combustion for the generation of electricity and heat for own use. Does not include evaporative emissions occurring at the refinery. These emissions should be reported separately under 1B2 a.  CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Manufacture of Solid Fuels and Other Energy Industries
Definition: Combustion emissions from fuel use during the manufacture of secondary and tertiary products from solid fuels, including the production of charcoal. Emissions from own on-site fuel use should be included. Also includes combustion for the generation of electricity and heat for their own use in these industries. 1A1c CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Manufacture of Solid Fuels
Definition: Emissions arising from fuel combustion for the production of coke, brown coal briquettes and patent fuel. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Energy Industries
Definition: Combustion emissions arising from the energy-producing industries' own (on-site) energy use, not mentioned above or for which separate data are not available. This includes the emissions from own-energy use for the production of charcoal, bagasse, saw dust, cotton stalks and carbonizing of biofuels, as well as fuel used for coal mining, oil and gas extraction and the processing and upgrading of natural gas. This category also includes emissions from pre-combustion processing for CO2 capture and storage. Combustion emissions from pipeline transport should be reported under1A3e. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Manufacturing Industries and Construction
Definition: Emissions from combustion of fuels in industry. Also includes combustion for the gen eration of electricity and heat for own use in these indus tries. Emissions from fuel combustion in coke ovens within the iron and steel industry should be reported under 1A1c and not within manufacturing industry. Emissions from the industry sector should be specified by sub-categories that correspond to the International Standard Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities (ISIC). En ergy used for transport by industry should not be reported here but under Transport (1A3). Emissions arising from off-road and other mobile machinery in industry should, if possible, be broken out as a separate subcategory. For each country, the emissions from the largest fuel-consumi ng industrial categories ISIC should be reported, as well as those from significant emitters of pollutants. A suggested list of categories is outlined below. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Iron and Steel
Definition: ISIC Group 271 and Class 2731. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non-Ferrous Metals
Definition: ISIC Group 272 and Class 2732. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Chemicals
Definition: ISIC Division 24. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Pulp, Paper and Print
Definition: ISIC Divisions 21 and 22. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Food Processing, Beverages and Tobacco
Definition: ISIC Divisions 15 and 16. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non-Metallic Minerals
Definition: Includes products such as glass ceramic, cement, etc. ISIC Division. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Transport Equipment
Definition: ISIC Divisions 34 and 35. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Machinery
Definition: Includes fabricated metal products, machinery and equipment other than transport equipment. ISIC Divisions 28, 29, 30, 31, and 32. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Mining (excluding fuels) and Quarrying
Definition: ISIC Divisions 13 and 14. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wood and Wood Products
Definition: ISIC Division 20. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Construction
Definition: ISIC Division 45. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Textile and Leather
Definition: ISIC Divisions 17, 18 and 19. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non-specified Industry
Definition: Any manufacturing industry/construction not included above or for which separate data are not available.  Includes ISIC Divisions 25, 33, 36 and 37. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Transport
Definition: Emissions from the combustion and evaporation of fuel for all transport activity (excluding military transport), regardless of the sector, specified by sub-categories below. Emissions from fuel sold to any air or marine vessel engaged in international transport (1A3ai and 1A3di) should as far as possible be excluded from the totals and subtotals in this category and should be reported separately. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Civil Aviation
Definition: Emissions from international and domestic civil aviation, including take-offs and landings. Comprises civil commercial use of aircraft, including: scheduled and charter traffic for passengers and freight, air taxiing, and general aviation. The international/domestic split should be determined on the basis of departure and landing locations for each flight stage and not by the nationality of the airline. Exclude use of fuel at airports for ground transport, which is reported under 1A3e Other Transportation. Also, exclude fuel for stationary combustion at airports; report this information under the appropriate stationary combustion category. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: International Aviation (International Bunkers)
Definition: Emissions from flights that depart in one country and arrive in a different country. Include take-offs and landings for these flight stages. Emissions from international military aviation can be included as a separate sub-category of international aviation provided that the same definitional distinction is applied and data ar e available to support the definition. i CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO

Name: Domestic Aviation
Definition: Emissions from civil domestic passenger and freight traffic that departs and arrives in the same country (commercial, private, agriculture, etc.), including take-offs and landings for these flight stages. Note that this may include journeys of considerable length between two airports in a country (e.g. San Francisco to Honolulu). Exclude military, which should be reported under 1A5 b. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Road Transportation
Definition: All combustion a nd evaporative emissions arising from fuel use in road vehicles, including the use of agricultural vehicles on paved roads. 1A3b CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Cars
Definition: Emissions from automobiles so designated in the vehicle registering country primarily for the transport of persons and normally have a capacity of persons or fewer. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Passenger Cars With 3-way Catalysts
Definition: Emissions from passenger car vehicles with 3-way catalysts. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Passenger Cars Without 3-way Catalysts
Definition: Passenger car emissions from vehicles without 3-way catalysts. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Light-duty Trucks
Definition: Emissions from vehicles so designated in the vehicle registering country primarily for transportation of light-weight cargo or which are equipped with special features such as four-wheel drive for off-road operation. The gross vehicle weight normally ranges up to 3500-3900 kg or less. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Light-duty Trucks With 3-way Catalysts
Definition: Emissions from light duty trucks with 3-way catalysts. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Light-duty Trucks Without 3-way Catalysts
Definition: Emissions from light duty trucks without 3-way catalysts. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Heavy-duty Trucks and Buses
Definition: Emissions from any vehicles so designated in the vehicle registering country. Normally the gross vehicle weight ranges from 3500-3900 kg or more for heavy duty trucks and the buses are rated to carry more than 12 persons. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Motorcycles
Definition: Emissions from any motor vehicle designed to travel with not more than three wheels in contact with the ground and weighing less than 680 kg. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Evaporative Emissions from Vehicles
Definition: Evaporative emissions from vehicles (e.g. hot soak, running losses) are included here. Emissions from loading fuel into vehicles are excluded. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Urea-based Catalysts
Definition: CO2 emissions from use of urea-based additives in catalytic converters (non-combustive emissions). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Railways
Definition: Emissions from railway transport for both freight and passenger traffic routes. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Water-borne Navigation
Definition: Emissions from fuels used to propel water-borne vessels, including hovercraft and hydrofoils, but excluding fishing vessels. The international/domestic split should be determined on the basis of port of departure and port of arrival, and not by the flag or nationality of the ship. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: International Water-borne Navigation (International Bunkers)
Definition: Emissions from fuels used by vessels of all flags that are engaged in international water-borne navigation. The international navigation may take place at sea, on inland lakes and waterways and in coastal waters. Includes emissions from journeys that depart in one country and arrive in a different country. Exclude consumption by fishing vessels (see Other Sector - Fishing). Emissions from international military water-borne navigation can be included as a separate sub-category of international water-borne navigation, provided that the same definitional distinction is applied and data are available to support the definition. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Domestic Water-borne Navigation
Definition: Emissions from fuels used by vessels of all flags that depart and arrive in the same country (exclude fishing, which should be reported under 1A4 ciii, and military, which should be reported under 1A5b). Note that this may include journeys of considerable length between two ports in a country (e.g. San Francisco to Honolulu). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Transportation
Definition: Combustion emissions from all remaining transport activities, including pipeline transportation, ground activities in airports and harbours, and off-road activities not otherwise reported under 1A4c Agriculture or 1A2. Manufacturing Industries and Construction. Military transport should be reported under 1A5 (see 1A5 Non-specified). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Pipeline Transport
Definition: Combustion-related emissions from the operation of pump stations and maintenance of pipelines. Transport via pipelines includes transport of gases, liquids, slurry and other commodities via pipelines. Distribution of natural or manufactured gas, water or steam from the distributor to final users is excluded and should be reported in 1A1cii or 1A4a. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Off-road
Definition: Combustion emissions from Ot her Transportation excluding Pipeline Transport. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Sectors
Definition: Emissions from combustion activities as described below, including combustion for the generation of electricity and heat for own use in these sectors. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Commercial/Institutional
Definition: Emissions from fuel combustion in commercial and institutional buildings; all activities included in ISIC Divisions 41, 50, 51, 52, 55, 63-67, 70-75, 80, 85, 90-93 and 99. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Residential
Definition: All emissions from fuel combustion in households. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Agriculture/Forestry/Fishing/Fish Farms
Definition: Emissions from fuel combustion in agriculture, forestry, fishing and fishing industries such as fish farms. Activities included in ISIC Divisions 01, 02 and 05. Highway agricultural transportation is excluded. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Stationary
Definition: Emissions from fuels combusted in pumps, grain drying, horticultural greenhouses and other agriculture, forestry or stationary combustion in the fishing industry. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Off-road Vehicles and Other Machinery
Definition: Emissions from fuels combusted in traction vehicles on farm land and in forests. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Fishing (mobile combustion)
Definition: Emissions from fuels combusted for inland, coastal and deep-sea fishing. Fishing should cover vessels of all flags that have refuelled in the country (include international fishing). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non-Specified
Definition: All remaining emissions from fuel combustion that are not specified elsewhere. Include emissions from fuel delivered to the military in the country and delivered to the military of other countries that are not engaged in multilateral operations. Emissions from fuel sold to any air or marine vessel engaged in multilateral operation pursuant to the Charter of the United Nations should be excluded from the totals and subtotals of the military transport and should be reported separately. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Stationary
Definition: Emissions from fuel combustion in stationary sources that are not specified elsewhere. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Mobile
Definition: Emissions from vehicles and other machinery, marine and aviation (not included in 1A4cii or elsewhere). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Mobile (Aviation Component)
Definition: All remaining aviation emissions from fuel combustion that are not specified elsewhere. Include emissions from fuel delivered to the country's military not otherwise included separately in 1A3ai as well as fuel delivered within that country but used by militaries of other countries that are not engaged in a multilateral operation pursuant to the Charter of the United Nations. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Mobile (Water-borne Component)
Definition: All remaining water-borne emissions from fuel combustion that are not specified elsewhere here. Include emissions from fuel delivered to the country's military not otherwise included separately in 1A3di as well as fuel delivered within that country but used by militaries of other countries that are not engaged in a multilateral operation pursuant to the Charter of the United Nations. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Mobile (Other)
Definition: All remaining emissions from mobile sources not included elsewhere. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Multilateral Operations
Definition: Emissions from fuel sold to any air or marine vessel engaged in multilateral operations pursuant to the Charter of the United Nations should be excluded from the totals and subtotals of the military transport, and should be reported separately. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Fugitive Emissions from Fuels
Definition: Includes all intentional and unintentional emissions from the extraction, processing, storage and transport of fuel to the point of final use. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Solid Fuels
Definition: Includes all intentional and unintentional emissions from the extraction, processing, storage and transport of fuel to the point of final use. CO2, CH4

Name: Coal Mining and Handling
Definition: Includes all fugitive emissions from coal. CO2, CH4

Name: Underground Mines
Definition: Includes all emissions arising from mining, post-mining, abandoned mines and flaring of drained methane. CO2, CH4

Name: Mining
Definition: Includes all seam gas emissions vented to the atmosphere from coal mine ventilation air and degasification systems. CO2, CH4

Name: Post-mining Seam Gas Emissions
Definition: Includes methane and CO2 emitted after coal has been mined, brought to the surface and subsequently processed, stored and transported. CO2, CH4

Name: Abandoned Underground Mines
Definition: Includes methane emissions from abandoned underground mines. CO2, CH4

Name: Flaring of Drained
Definition: Methane or Conversion of Methane to CO2 Methane drained and flared, or ventilation gas converted to CO2 by an oxidation process should be included here. Methane used for energy production should be included in Volume 2, Energy, Chapter 2 Stationary Combustion. CO2, CH4

Name: Surface Mines
Definition: Includes all seam gas emissions arising from surface coal mining. ii CO2, CH4,

Name: Mining
Definition: Includes methane and CO2 emitted during mining from breakage of coal and associated strata and leakage from the pit floor and high wall. CO2, CH4,

Name: Post-mining Seam Gas Emissions
Definition: Includes methane and CO2 emitted after coal has been mined, subsequently processed, stored and transported. CO2, CH4

Name: Uncontrolled Combustion, and Burning Coal Dumps
Definition: Includes fugitive emissions of CO2 from uncontrolled combustion in coal. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Solid Fuel Transformation
Definition: Fugitive emissions arising during the manufacture of secondary and tertiary products from solid fuels. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Oil and Natural Gas
Definition: Comprises fugitive emissions from all oil and natural gas activities. The primary sources of these emissions may include fugitive equipment leaks, evaporation losses, venting, flaring and accidental releases. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Oil
Definition: Comprises emissions from venting, flaring and all other fugitive sources associated with the exploration, production, transmission, upgrading, and refining of crude oil and distribution of crude oil products. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Venting
Definition: Emissions from venting of associated gas and waste gas/vapour streams at oil facilities. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Flaring
Definition: Emissions from flaring of natural gas and waste gas/vapour streams at oil facilities. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: All Other
Definition: Fugitive emissions at oil facilities from equipment leaks, storage losses, pipeline breaks, well blowouts, land farms, gas migration to the surface around the outside of wellhead casing, surface casing vent bows, biogenic gas formation from tailings ponds and any other gas or vapour releases not specifically accounted for as venting or flaring. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Exploration
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from oil well drilling, drill stem testing, and well completions. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Production and Upgrading
Definition: Fugitive emissions from oil production (excluding venting and flaring) occur at the oil wellhead or at the oil sands or shale oil mine through to the start of the oil transmission system. This includes fugitive emissions related to well servicing, oil sands or shale oil mining, transport of untreated production (i.e , well effluent, emulsion, oil shale and oilsands) to treating or extrac tion facilities, activities at extraction and upgrading facilities, associated gas re- injection systems and produced water disposal systems. Fugitive emission from upgraders are grouped with those from production rather than t hose from refining since the upgraders are often integrated with extraction facilities and their relative emission contributio ns are difficult to establish. However, upgraders may also be integrated with refineries, co-generation plants or other i ndustrial facilities and their relative emission contributions c an be difficult to establish in these cases. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Transport
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) related to the transport of marketable crude oil (including conventional, heavy and synthetic crude oil and bitumen) to upgraders and refineries. The transportation systems may comprise pipelines, marine tankers, tank trucks and rail cars. Evaporation losses from storage, filling and unloading activities and fugitive equipment leaks are the primary sources of these emissions. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Refining
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) at petroleum refineries. Refineries process crude oils, natural gas liquids and synthetic crude oils to produce final refined products (e.g., primarily fuels and lubricants). Where refineries are integrated with ot her facilities (for example, upgraders or cogeneration plants), their relative emission contributions can be difficult to establish. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Distribution of Oil Products
Definition: This comprises fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from the transport and distribution of refined products, including those at bulk terminals and retail facilities. Evaporation losses from storage, filling and unloading activities and fugitive equipment leaks are the primary sources of these emissions. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Other
Definition: Fugitive emissions from oil systems (excluding venting and flaring) not otherwise accounted for in the above categories. This includes fugitive emissions from spills and other accidental releases, waste oil treatment facilities and oilfield waste disposal facilities. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Natural Gas
Definition: Comprises emissi ons from venting, flaring and all other fugitive sources associated with the exploration, production, processing, transmission, stor age and distribution of natural gas (including both associat ed and non-associated gas). CO2, CH4, NMVOC,

Name: Venting
Definition: Emissions from venting of natural gas and waste gas/vapour streams at gas facilities. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Flaring
Definition: Emissions from flaring of natural gas and waste gas/vapour streams at gas facilities. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: All Other
Definition: Fugitive emissions at natural gas facilities from equipment leaks, storage losses, pipeline breaks, well blowouts, gas migration to the surface around the outside of wellhead casing, surface casing vent bows and any other gas or vapour releases not specifically accounted for as venting or flaring. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Exploration
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from gas well drilling, drill stem testing and well completions. i CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Production
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from the gas wellhead through to the inlet of gas processing plants, or, where processing is not required, to the tie-in points on gas transmission systems. This includes fugitive emissions related to well servicing, gas gathering, processing and associated wastewater and acid gas disposal activities. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Processing
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from gas processing facilities. iii CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Transmission and Storage
Definition: Fugitive emissions from systems used to transport processed natural gas to ma rket (i.e., to industrial consumers and natural gas distribution systems). Fugitive emissions from natural gas st orage systems should also be included in this category. Emissi ons from natural gas liquids extraction plants on gas transmission systems should be reported as part of natural gas processing (Sector 1B2biii3). Fugitive emissions related to the transmission of natural gas liquids shoul d be reported under Category 1B2aiii3. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Distribution
Definition: Fugitive emissions (excluding venting and flaring) from the distribution of natural gas to end users.  CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Other
Definition: Fugitive emissions from natural gas systems (excluding venting and flaring) not otherwise accounted for in the above categories. This may include emissions from well blowouts and pipeline ruptures or dig-ins. CO2, CH4, NMVOC

Name: Other Emissions from Energy Production
Definition: Other fugitive emissions for example, from geothermal energy production, peat and other energy production not included in 1B2. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Carbon Dioxide Transport and Storage
Definition: Carbon dioxide (CO2) capture and storage (CCS) involves the capture of CO2 from anthropogenic sources, its transport to a storage location and its long-term isolation from the atmosphere. Emissions associated with CO2 transport, injection and storage are covered under the category 1C. Emissions (and reductions) associated with CO2 capture should be reported under the IPCC sector in which capture takes place (e.g. Fuel Combustion or Industrial Activities).

Name: Transport of CO2
Definition: This comprises fugitive emissions from the systems used to transport captured CO2 from the source to the injection site. These emissions may compri se losses due to fugitive equipment leaks, venting and releases due to pipeline ruptures or other accidental releases (e.g., temporary storage). CO2

Name: Pipelines
Definition: Fugitive emissions from the pipeline system used to transport CO2 to the injection site. CO2

Name: Ships
Definition: Fugitive emissions from the ships used to transport CO2 to the injection site. CO2

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Fugitive emissions from other systems used to transport CO2 to the injection site and temporary storage. CO2

Name: Injection and Storage
Definition: Fugitive emissions from ac tivities and equipment at the injection site and those from the end containment once the CO2 is placed in storage. CO2,

Name: Injection
Definition: Fugitive emission s from activities and equipment at the injection site. CO2

Name: Storage
Definition: Fugitive emissions from the end equipment once the CO2 is placed in storage. CO2

Name: Other
Definition: Any other emissions from CCS not reported elsewhere. CO2

Name: INDUSTRIAL PROCESSES AND PRODUCT USE
Definition: Emissions from industrial processes and product use, excluding those related to energy combustion (reported under 1A), extraction, processing, and transport of fuels (reported under 1B) and CO2 transport, injection and storage (reported under 1C).

Name: Mineral Industry
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Cement Production
Definition: Process-related emissions fr om the production of various types of cement (ISIC: D2694). CO2, CH4

Name: Lime Production
Definition: Process-related emissions fr om the production of various types of lime (ISIC: D2694). CO2, CH4

Name: Glass Production
Definition: Process-related emissions fr om the production of various types of glass (ISIC: D2610). CO2, CH4

Name: Other Process Uses of Carbonates
Definition: Includes limestone, dolomite and other carbonates etc. Emissions from the use of limestone, dolomite and other carbonates should be included in the industrial source category where they are emitted. Therefore, for example, where a carbonate is used as a flux for iron and steel production, resultant emissions should be reported under 2C1 Iron and steel production rather than this subcategory.

Name: Ceramics
Definition: Process-related emissions from the production of bricks and roof tiles, vitrified clay pipes, refractory products, expanded clay products, wall and floor tiles, table and ornamental ware (household ceramics), sanitary ware, technical ceramics, and inorganic bonded abrasives (ISIC: D2691, D2692 and D2693). CO2, CH4

Name: Other Uses of Soda Ash
Definition: This should include emissions from soda ash use that are not included elsewhere. For example, soda ash used for glass should be reported in 2A3. CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non Metallurgical Magnesia Production
Definition: This source category should include emissions from magnesia production that are not included elsewhere. For example, where magnesia production is used for primary and secondary magnesium production, emissions should be reported in the relevant source category in Metals. CO2, CH4

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Process-related emissions reported under this sub-category should include all other miscellaneous uses of limestone, dolomite and other carbonates, except from uses already listed in the sub-categories above, and uses as fluxes or slagging agents in the Metals and Chemicals industries, or for the liming of soils and wetlands in Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Uses (ISIC D269). CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Chemical Industry
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Ammonia Production
Definition: Ammonia (NH3) is a major industrial chemical and the most important nitrogenous material produced. Ammonia gas is used directly as a fertilizer, in heat treating, paper pulping, nitric acid and nitrates manufacture, nitric acid ester and nitro compound manufacture, explosives of various types, and as a refrigerant. Amines, amides, and miscellaneous other organic compounds, such as urea, are made from ammonia. The main greenhouse gas emitted from NH3 production is CO2. CO2 used in the production of urea, a downstream process, should be subtracted from the CO2 generated and accounted for in the AFOLU Sector. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Nitric Acid Production
Definition: Nitric acid is used as a raw material mainly in the manufacture of nitrogenous-based fertilizer. Nitric acid may also be used in the production of adipic acid and explosives (e.g., dynamite), for metal etching and in the processing of ferrous metals. The main greenhouse gas emitted from HNO3 production is nitrous oxide. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Adipic Acid Production
Definition: Adipic acid is used in the manufacture of a large number of products, including synthetic fibres, coatings, plastics, urethane foams, elastomers and synthetic lubricants. The production of Nylon 6.6 accounts for the bulk of adipic acid use. The main greenhouse gas emitted from adipic acid production is nitrous oxide. N2O, CO2, CH4 , NOx

Name: Caprolactam, Glyoxal and Glyoxylic Acid Production
Definition: Most of the annual production of caprolactam (NH(CH2)5CO) is consumed as the monomer for nylon-6 fibres and plastics, with a subs tantial proportion of the fibre used in carpet manufacturing. All commercial processes for the manufacture of caprolactam are based on either toluene or benzene. This subcategory also covers production of glyoxal (ethanedial) and glyoxylic acid production. The main greenhouse gas emitted from this subcategory is nitrous oxide. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Carbide Production
Definition: The production of carbide can result in emissions of CO2, CH4, CO and SO2. Silicon carbide is a significant artificial abrasive. It is produced from silica sand or quartz and petroleum coke. Calcium carbide is used in the production of acetylene, in the manufacture of cyanamide (a minor historical use), and as a reductant in electric arc steel furnaces. It is made from calcium carbonate (limestone) and carbon-containing reductant (petroleum coke). CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Titanium Dioxide Production
Definition: Titanium dioxide (TiO2) is the most important white pigment. The main use is in paint manufacture followed by paper, plastics, rubber, ceramics, fabrics, floor covering, printing ink, and other miscellaneous uses. The main production process is the chloride route, giving rise to CO2 emissions that are likely to be significant. This category also includes synthetic rutile production using the Becher process, and titanium slag production, both of which are reduction processes using fossil fuels and resulting in CO2 emissions. Synthetic rutile is the major input to TiO2 production using the chloride route.

Name: Soda Ash Production
Definition: Soda ash (sodium carbonate, Na3) is a white crystalline solid that is used as a raw material in a large number of industries, including glass manufacture, soap and detergents, pulp and paper production and water treatment. Emissions of CO2 from the production of soda ash vary dependent on the manufacturing process. Four different processes may be used to produce soda ash. Three of these processes, monhydrate, sodium sesquicabonate (trona) and direct carbonation, are referred to as natural processes. The fourth, the Solvay process, is classified as a synthetic process.

Name: Petrochemical and Carbon Black Production
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Methanol
Definition: Methanol production covers production of methanol from fossil fuel feedstocks [natural gas, petroleum, coal] using steam reforming or partial oxidation processes. Production of methanol from biogenic feedstocks (e.g., by fermentation) is not included in this source category. CO2, CH4, N2O, NMVOC

Name: Ethylene
Definition: Ethylene production covers the production of ethylene from fossil fuel-derived feedstocks at petrochemical plants by the steam cracking process. Production of ethylene from process situations within the boundaries of petroleum refineries is not included in this source category. The greenhouse gases produced from ethylene production are carbon dioxide and methane. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Ethylene Dichloride and Vinyl Chloride Monomer
Definition: Ethylene dichloride and vinyl chloride monomer production covers production of ethylene dichloride by direct oxidation or oxychlorination of ethyl ene, and the production of vinyl chloride monomer from ethylene dichloride. The greenhouse gases produced from production of ethylene dichloride production and vinyl chloride monomer production are carbon dioxide and methane. CO2, CH4, N2O, CO, NMVOC

Name: Ethylene Oxide
Definition: Ethylene oxide production covers production of ethylene oxide by reaction of ethylene and oxygen by catalytic oxidation. The greenhouse gases produced from ethylene oxide production are carbon dioxide and methane. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Acrylonitrile
Definition: Acrylonitrile producti on covers production of acrylonitrile from ammoxidation of propylene, and associated production of acetonitrile and hydrogen cyanide from the ammoxidation process. The greenhouse gases produced from production of acrylonitrile are carbon dioxide and methane. CO2, CH4, N2O, NMVOC

Name: Carbon Black
Definition: Carbon black production covers production of carbon black from fossil fuel-derived feedstocks (petroleum or coal-derived carbon black feedstock, natural gas, acetylene). Production of carbon black from biogenic feedstocks is not included in this source category. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Fluorochemical Production
Definition: HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogen ated gases

Name: By-product Emissions
Definition: Fluorochemical Production covers the complete range of fluorochemicals, whether or not the principal products are greenhouse gases. Emissions encompass HFCs, PFCs, SF6 and all other halogenated gases with global warming potential listed in IPCC assessment reports. The most significant by-product emission is that of HFC-23 from the manufacture of HCFC-22 and this is described separately. HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogen ated gases

Name: Fugitive Emissions
Definition: These are emissions of the principal product from the process to manufacture it, and so fluorochemical production in this context is limited to HFCs, PFCs,  SF6 and other halogenated gases with global warming potential listed in IPCC assessment reports. HFCs, PFCs,  SF6, other halogenated gases

Name: Other (Please specify)
Definition: For example, gases with global warming potential listed in IPCC assessment reports that do not fall within any categories above could be reported here, if they are estimated. CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Metal Industry
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Iron and Steel Production
Definition: Carbon dioxide is the predominant gas emitted from the production of iron and steel. The sources of the carbon dioxide emissions include that from carbon-containing reducing agents such as coke and pulverized coal, and, from minerals such as limestone and dolomite added. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Ferroalloys Production
Definition: Ferroalloys production covers emissions from primary metallurgical reduction production of the most common ferroalloys, i.e. ferro-silicon, silicon metal, ferro-manganese, silicon manganese, and ferro-chromium, excluding those emissions relating to fuel use. From the production of these alloys, carbon dioxide (CO2), nitrous oxide (N2O), and methane (CH4) originating from ore and reductant raw materials are emitted. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO

Name: Aluminium Production
Definition: Aluminium Production covers primary production of aluminium, except the emissions related to the use of fuel. Carbon dioxide emissions result from the electrochemical reduction reaction of aluminum with a carbon-based anode. Tetrafluoromethane (CF 4) and hexafluoroethane (C ) are also produced intermittently. No greenhouse gases are produced in recycling of aluminium other than from the fuels uses for metal remelting. Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) emissions are not associated with primary aluminium production; however, casting of some high magnesium containing alloys does result in SF6 emissions and these emissions are accounted for in Section 2C4, Magnesium Production. CO2, CH4, PFCs, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Magnesium Production
Definition: Magnesium production covers GHG emissions related to both primary magnesium producti on as well as oxidation protection of magnesium metal during processing (recycling and casting), excluding those emi ssions relating to fuel use. In the primary production of magnesium, carbon dioxide (CO2) is emitted during calcination of dolomite and magnesite raw materials. Primary production of magnesium from non-carbonate raw materials does not emit carbon dioxide. In the processing of liquid magnesium, cover gases containing carbon dioxide (CO2), sulphur hexafluoride ( SF6), the hydrofluorocarbon HFC 134a or the fluorinated ketone FK 5-1-12 ( C3F7C(O)C 2F5) may be used. Partial thermal decomposition and/or reaction between these compounds and liquid magnesium generates secondary compounds such as perfluoroc arbons (PFCs), which are emitted in addition to unreact ed cover gas constituents. 2C4 CO2, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO

Name: Lead Production
Definition: Lead production covers production by the sintering/smelting process as well as direct smelting. Carbon dioxide emissions result as a product of the use of a variety of carbon-based reducing agents in both production processes. CO2

Name: Zinc Production
Definition: Zinc production covers emissions from both primary production of zinc from ore as well as recovery of zinc from scrap metals, excluding emissions related to fuel use. Following calcination, zinc metal is produced through one of three methods: 1-electrothermal distillation, 2-pyro-metallurgical smelting or 3-electrolysis. If method 1 or 2 is used, carbon dioxide (CO2) is emitted. Method 3 does not result in carbon dioxide emissions. Recovery of zinc from metal scrap often uses the same methods as primary production and may thus produce carbon dioxide emissions, which is included in this section. CO2

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs,  SF6, other halogenated gases, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Non-Energy Products from Fuels and Solvent Use
Definition: The use of oil products and coal-derived oils primarily intended for purposes other than combustion.

Name: Lubricant Use
Definition: Lubricating oils, heat transfer oils, cutting oils and greases. CO2

Name: Paraffin Wax Use
Definition: Oil-derived waxes such as petroleum jelly, paraffin waxes and other waxes.  CO2, CH4, N2O

Name: Solvent Use
Definition: NMVOC emissions from solvent use e.g. in paint application, degreasing and dry cleaning should be contained here. Emissions from the use of HFCs and PFCs as solvents should be reported under 2F5. , NMVOC

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: For example, CH4, CO and NMVOC emissions from asphalt production and use (including asphalt blowing), as well as NMVOC emissions from the use of other chemical products than solvents, should be contained here, if relevant. 2A5, 2A6,

Name: Electronics Industry
Definition: 2F6 CO2, CH4, N2O, PFCs, HFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases

Name: Integrated Circuit or Semiconductor
Definition: Emissions of CF4, C2F6 , C3F8, c-C4F8 , C4F6, C4F8O, C5F8, CHF3, CH2F2, NF3 and  SF6 from uses of these gases in Integrated Circuit (IC) manufacturing in rapidly evolving ways and in varying amounts, which depend on product (e.g., memory or logic devices) and equipment manufacturer. CO2, N2O, PFCs, HFCs, SF6, other halogen ated gases

Name: TFT Flat Panel Display
Definition: Uses and emissions of predominantly CF 4, CHF 3, NF 3 and SF6 during the fabrication of the in-film transistors (TFTs) on glass substrates for flat panel display manufacture. In addition to these gases, C2F6 , C3F8 and c-C4F8 may also be used and emitted during the manufacture of thin and smart displays. PFCs, HFCs,  SF6, other halogenated gaseS

Name: Photovoltaics
Definition: Photovoltaic cell manufacture may use and emit CF4 and C2F6, among others. PFCs, HFCs,  SF6, other halogenated gases

Name: Heat Transfer Fluid
Definition: Heat transfer fluids, which include several fully fluorinated carbon compounds (either in pure form or in mixtures) with six or more carbon atoms, are used and emitted during IC manufacture, testing and assembly. They are used in chillers, temperature shock testers and vapour phase reflow soldering. 2F6 other halogenated gases

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs,  SF6, other halogen ated gases

Name: Product Uses as Substitutes for Ozone Depleting Substances
Definition: CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogen ated gases

Name: Refrigeration and Air Conditioning
Definition: Refrigeration and air-conditioning systems are usually classified in six application domains or categories. These categories utilize different technologies such as heat exchangers, expansion devices, piping and compressors. The six application domains are domestic refrigeration, commercial refrigeration, industrial processes, transport refrigeration, stationary air conditioning, and mobile air conditioning systems. For all these applications, various HFCs are selectively replacing CFCs and HCFCs. For example, in developed countries, HFC-134a has replaced CFC-12 in domestic refrigeration and mobile air conditioning systems, and blends of HFCs such as R-407C (HFC-32/HFC-125/HFC-134a) and R-410A (HFC-32/HFC-125) are replacing HCFC-22 mainly in stationary air conditioning. Other, non-HFC substances are used to replace CFCs and HCFCs such as iso-butane in domestic refrigeration or ammonia in industrial refrigeration. HFC- 152a is also being considered for mobile air conditioning in several regions. CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Refrigeration and Stationary Air Conditioning
Definition: The application domains are domestic refrigeration, commercial refrigeration, industrial processes, and stationary air conditioning. CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Mobile Air Conditioning
Definition: The applicati on domains are transport refrigeration, mobile air-conditioning systems. CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gaseS

Name: Foam Blowing Agents
Definition: HFCs are being used as replacements for CFCs and HCFCs in foams, particularly in closed-cell insulation applications. Compounds that are being used include HFC-245fa, HFC-365mfc, HFC-227ea, HFC-134a, and HFC-152a. The processes and applications for which these various HFCs are being used include insulation boards and panels, pipe sections, sprayed systems and one-component gap-filling foams. For open-cell foams, such as integral skin products for automotive steering wheels and facias, emissions of HFCs used as blowing agents are likely to occur during the manufacturing process. In closed-cell foam, emissions not only occur during the manufacturing phase, but usually extend into the in-use phase and often the majority of emissions occur at the end-of-life (de-commissioning losses) . Accordingly, emissions can occur over a period of up to 50 years or even longer. CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Fire Protection
Definition: There are two general types of fire protection (fire suppression) equipment that use greenhouse gases as partial replacements for halons: portable (streaming) equipment, and fixed (flooding) equipment. The non-ozone-depleting, industrial gases HFCs, PFCs and, more recently a fluoroketone are mainly used as substitutes for halons, typically halon 1301, in flooding equipment. PFCs played an early role in halon 1301 replacement but current use is limited to replenishment of previously installed systems. HFCs in portable equipment, ty pically replacing halon 1211, are available but have achieved very limited market acceptance due primarily to their high cost. PFC use in new portable extinguishers is currently limited to a small amount (few percent) in an HCFC blend. 2F3 CO2, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Aerosols
Definition: Most aerosol packages now contain hydrocarbons (HC) as propellants, but in a small fraction of the total, HFCs and PFCs may be used as propellants or solvents. Emissions from aerosols usually occur shortly after production, on average, six months after sale. During the use of aerosols, 100% of the chemical is emitted. The 5 main sources are metered dose inhalers (MDIs), personal care products (e.g. hair care, deodorant, shaving cream), household products (e.g. air-fresheners, oven and fabric cleaners), industrial products (e.g. special cleaning sprays such as those for operating electrical contact, lubricants, pipe-freezers) and other general products (e.g. silly string, tire inflators, claxons), although in some regions the use of such general products is restricted. The HFCs currently used as propellants are HFC 134a, HFC 227ea, and HFC 152a. The substance HFC 43 10mee and a PFC, perfluorohexane, are used as solvents in industrial aerosol products. 2F4 HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Solvents
Definition: HFCs and, to a much lesser extent PFCs, are being used as substitutes for ozone-depleting substances (most notably CFC-113). Typical HFCs used are HFC-365mfc and HFC-43-10mee. Use of these fluorinated replacements is much less widespread than the ozone-depleting substances they replace. Re-capture and re-use is also much more widely practiced. The primary areas of use are precision cleaning, electroni cs cleaning, metal cleaning and deposition applications. Emissions from aerosols containing solvents should be reported under category 2F4 Aerosols rather than under this category. 2F5 HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Other Applications (please specify)
Definition: The properties of ozone-depleting substances have made them attractive for a variety of niche applications not covered in other sub-source categories. These include electronics testing, heat transfer, dielectric fluid and medical applications. The properties of HFCs and PFCs are equally attractive in some of these sectors and they have been adopted as substitutes. There are also some historical uses of PFCs, as well as emerging uses of HFCs, in these applications. These applications have leakage rates ranging from 100% emissive in the year of application to around 1% per annum. 2F6 CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: OTHER PRODUCT MANUFACTURE AND USE
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs, SF6, other halogenated gases

Name: Electrical Equipment
Definition: Electrical equipment is used in the transmission and distribution of electricity above 1 kV. SF6 is used in gas-insulated switchgear (GIS), gas circuit breakers (GCB), gas-insulated transformers (GIT ), gas-insulated lines (GIL), outdoor gas-insulated instrument transformers, reclosers, switches, ring main units and other equipment. 2F6 SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Manufacture of Electrical Equipment
Definition: SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Use of Electrical Equipment
Definition: SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Disposal of Electrical Equipment
Definition: SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: SF6 and PFCs from Other Product
Definition: SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Military Applications
Definition: Military applications include AWACS, which are military reconnaissance planes of the Boeing E-3A type. In AWACS (and possibly other reconnaissance planes), the SF6 is used as an insulating gas in the radar system. SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: Accelerators
Definition: 2F6 SF6, PFCs, other halogen ated gases

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Particle accelerators are used for research purposes (at universities and research institutions), for industrial applications (in cross-linking polymers for cable insulation and for rubber parts and hoses), and in medical (radiotherapy) applications. This source includes adiabatic uses, sound-proof glazing, PFCs used as heat transfer fluids in consumer and commercial applications, PFCs used in cosmetic and medical applications, and PFCs and SF6 used as tracers. 2F6 SF6, PFCs, other halogenated gases

Name: N2O from Product Uses
Definition: N2O

Name: Medical Applications
Definition: This source covers evaporative emissions of nitrous oxide (N2O) that arise from medical applications (anaesthetic use, analgesic use and veterinary use). N2O is used during anaesthesia for two reasons: a) as an anaesthetic and analgesic and as b) a carrier gas for volatile fluorinated hydrocarbon anaesthetics such as isoflurane, sevoflurane and desflurane. N2O

Name: Propellant for Pressure and Aerosol Products
Definition: This source covers evaporative emissions of nitrous oxide (N2O) that arise from use as a propellant in aerosol products primarily in the food industry. Typical usage is to make whipped cream, where cartridges filled with N2O are used to blow the cream into foam. N2O

Name: Other (Please s pecify)
Definition: N2O

Name: Other (Please specify)
Definition: CO2, CH4, HFCs, other halogen ated gases Chapter 8: Reporting Guidance and Tables 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories 8.27 TABLE 8.2 (CONTINUED ) CLASSIFICATION AND DEFINITION OF CATEGORIES OF EMISSIONS AND REMOVALS Category Code and Name Definition

Name: Other
Definition: CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Pulp and Paper Industry
Definition: CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Food and Beverages Industry
Definition: CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other (please specify
Definition: CO2, CH4, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, AND OTHER LAND USE
Definition: Emissions and removals from forest land, cropland, grassland, wetlands, settlements, and other land. Also includes emissions from livestock and manure management, emissions from managed soils, and emissions from liming and urea application. Methods to estimate annual harvested w ood product (HWP) variables are also covered in this category. 4,5 CH4, N2O, CO2

Name: Livestock
Definition: Methane emissions from enteric fermentation, and methane and nitrous oxide emissions from manure management. CH4

Name: Enteric Fermentation
Definition: Methane emissions from herbivores as a by-product of enteric fermentation (a digestive process by which carbohydrates are broken down by micro-organisms into simple molecules for absorption into the bloodstream). Ruminant animals (e.g., cattle, sheep) are major sources with moderate amounts produced from non-ruminant animals (e.g., pigs, horses). CH4

Name: Cattle
Definition: Methane emissions from dairy cows and other cattle. CH4

Name: Dairy Cows
Definition: Methane emissions from cattle producing milk for commercial exchange and from calves and heifers being grown for dairy purposes. CH4

Name: Other Cattle
Definition: Methane emissions from all non-dairy cattle including: cattle kept or grown for meat production, draft animals, and breeding animals. CH4

Name: Buffalo
Definition: Methane emissions from buffalo. CH4

Name: Sheep
Definition: Methane emissions from sheep. CH4

Name: Goats
Definition: Methane emissions from goats. CH4

Name: Camels
Definition: Methane emissions from camels. CH4

Name: Horses
Definition: Methane emissions from horses. CH4

Name: Mules and Asses
Definition: Methane emissions from mules and asses. CH4

Name: Swine
Definition: Methane emissions from swine. CH4

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Methane emissions from other livestock (e.g. alpacas, llamas, deer, reindeer, etc.). CH4

Name: Manure Management
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure under low oxygen or anaerobic conditions. These conditions often occur when large numbers of animals are managed in a confined area (e.g. dairy farms, beef feedlots, and swine and poultry farms), where manure is typically stored in large piles or disposed of in lagoons and other types of manure management systems. CH4, N2O

Name: Cattle
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from cattle. CH4, N2O

Name: Dairy Cows
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from dairy cows. CH4, N2O

Name: Other Cattle
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from other cattle. CH4, N2O

Name: Buffalo
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from buffalo. CH4, N2O

Name: Sheep
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from sheep. CH4, N2O

Name: Goats
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from goats. CH4, N2O

Name: Camels
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from camels. CH4, N2O

Name: Horses
Definition: Methane and ni trous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from horses. CH4, N2O

Name: Mules and Asses
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from mules and assess. CH4, N2O

Name: Swine
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from swine. CH4, N2O

Name: Poultry
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from poultry including chicken, broilers, turkeys, and ducks. CH4, N2O

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Methane and nitrous oxide emissions from the decomposition of manure from other livestock (e.g. alpacas, llamas, deer, reindeer, fur-bearing animals, ostriches, etc.) CH4, N2O

Name: Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from five land use categories (Forest land, Cropland, Grasslands, Settlements, and Other land) except for sources listed under (Aggregate sources and non-CO2 emissions sources on land) . Except for Wetlands, the greenhouse gas inventory involves estimation of changes in carbon stock from five carbon pools (i.e. aboveground biomass, belowground biomass, dead wood, litter, and soil organic matter), as appropriate. CO2, CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from lands with woody vegetation consistent with thresholds used to define forest land in the national GHG inventory, subdivided into managed and unmanaged, and possibly also by climatic region, soil type and vegetation type as appropriate. It also includes systems with vegetation that currently fall below, but are expected to later exceed, the threshold values used by a country to define the forest land category. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Forest Land Remaining Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from managed forests and plantations which have always been under forest land use or other land categories converted to forest over the years ago (default assumption). CO2, CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from lands converted to forest land. Includes conversion of cropland, grassland, wetlands, settlements, and other land to forest land. Even abandoned lands which are regenerating into forest due to human activities are also included. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO

Name: Cropland Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from cropland converted to forest land. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Grassland Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from grassland converted to forest land. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wetlands Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from wetlands converted to forest land. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Settlements Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from settlements converted to forest land. CO2, CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Land Converted to Forest Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from other land converted to forest land. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from arable and tillage land, rice fields, and agro-forestry systems where vegetation falls below the thresholds used for the forest land category. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Cropland Remaining Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from cropland that has not undergone any land use change during the inventory period. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from lands converted to cropland. Includes conversion of forest land, grassland, wetlands, settlements, and other land to cropland. , CO2, CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Forest Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from forest land converted to cropland. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Grassland Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from grassland converted to cropland. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wetlands Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from wetlands converted to cropland. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Settlements Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from settlements converted to cropland. CO2, CH4 ,N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Converted to Cropland
Definition: Emissions and removals from other land converted to cropland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from rangelands and pastureland that is not considered cropland. It also includes systems with woody vegetation that fall below the threshold values used in the forest land category and are not expected to exceed them, without human intervention. The category also includes all grassland from wild lands to recreational areas, as well as agricultural and silvopastoral systems, subdivided into managed and unmanaged, consistent with national definitions. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Grassland Remaining Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from grassland remaining grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from land converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Forest Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from forest land converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Cropland Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from cropland converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wetlands Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from wetlands converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Settlements Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from settlements converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Other Converted to Grassland
Definition: Emissions and removals from other land converted to grassland. CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wetlands
Definition: Emissions from land that is covered or saturated by water for all or part of the year (e.g., peatland) and that does not fall into the forest land, cropland, grassland or settlements categories. The category can be subdivided into managed and unmanaged according to national definitions. It includes reservoirs as a managed subdivision and natural rivers and lakes as unmanaged subdivisions.  CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Wetlands Remaining Wetlands
Definition: Emissions from peatland undergoing peat extraction and from flooded land remaining flooded land.  CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Peatlands Remaining peatlands
Definition: Includes (1) on-site emissions from peat deposits during the extraction phase and (2) off-site emissions from horticultural use of peat. The off-site emissions from the energy use of peat are reported in the Energy Sector and are therefore not included in this category.  CO2, CH4 , N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Flooded Land Remaining Flooded Land
Definition: Emissions from flooded land remaining flooded land. Flooded lands are defined as water bodies where human activities have caused changes in the amount of surface area covered by water, typically through water level regulation. Examples of flooded lands include reservoirs for the production of hydroelectricity, irrigation, navigation, etc. Regulated lakes and rivers that have not experienced substantial changes in water area in comparison with the pre-flooded ecosystem are not considered as flooded lands. Some rice paddies are cultivated through flooding of land, but because of the unique characteristics of rice cultivation, rice paddies are addressed in 3C7. CO2, CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO

Name: Land Converted to Wetlands
Definition: Emissions from land being converted for peat extraction from land converted to wetland. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted for Peat Extraction
Definition: Emissions from land being c onverted for peat extraction. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted to Flooded Land
Definition: Emissions from land converted to flooded land. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Land Converted to Other Wetlands
Definition: Emissions from land converted to other wetlands than flooded land and land for peat extraction. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from all developed land, including transportation infrastructure and human settlements of any size, unless they are already included under other categories. This should be consistent with national definitions. CO2

Name: Settlements Remaining Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from settlements that have not undergone any land use change during the inventory period. CO2

Name: Land Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from lands converted to settlements. Includes conversion of forest land, cropland, grassland, wetlands, and other land to settlements. CO2

Name: Forest Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from forest land converted to settlements. CO2

Name: Cropland Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from cropland converted to settlements. CO2

Name: Grassland Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from grassland converted to settlements. CO2

Name: Wetlands Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from wetlands converted to settlements. CO2

Name: Other Converted to Settlements
Definition: Emissions and removals from other land converted to settlements. CO2

Name: Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from bare soil, rock, ice, and all unmanaged land areas that do not fall into any of the other five categories. It allows the total of identified land areas to match the national area, where data are available. CO2

Name: Other Land Remaining Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from other land that has not undergone any land use change during the inventory period. CO2

Name: Land Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from lands converted to other land. Includes conversion of forest land, cropland, grassland, wetlands, and settlements to other land. CO2

Name: Forest Land Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from forest land converted to other land. CO2

Name: Cropland Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from cropland converted to other land. CO2

Name: Grassland Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from grassland converted to other land. CO2

Name: Wetlands Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from wetlands converted to other land. CO2

Name: Settlements Converted to Other Land
Definition: Emissions and removals from settlements converted to other land. CO2

Name: Aggregate Sources and Non-CO2 Emissions Sources on Land
Definition: Includes emissions from activi ties that are likely to be reported at very high aggregation land level or even country level.

Name: Emissions from Biomass Burning
Definition: Emissions from biomass burning include N2O and CH4. CO2 emissions are included here only if emissions are not included in categories as carbon stock changes. N2O, CH4, CO2*

Name: Biomass Burning in Forest Lands
Definition: Emissions from biomass burning that include N2O and CH4 in forest lands. CO2 emissions are included here only if emissions are not included in categories as carbon stock changes. N2O , CH4, CO2*

Name: Biomass Burning in Croplands
Definition: Emissions from biomass burning that include N2O and CH4 in croplands. CO2 emissions are included here only if emissions are not included in categories as carbon stock changes. N2O, CH4, CO2*

Name: Biomass Burning in Grasslands
Definition: Emissions from biomass burning that include N2O and CH4 in grasslands. CO2 emissions are included here only if emissions are not included in 3B3 categories as carbon stock changes. N2O, CH4, CO2*

Name: Biomass Burning in All Other Land
Definition: Emissions from biomass burning that include N2O and CH4 in settlements, and all other land. CO2 emissions are included here only if emissions are not included in categories as carbon stock changes. N2O, CH4, CO2*

Name: Liming
Definition: CO2 emissions from the use of lime in agricultural soils, managed forest soils or lakes . CO2

Name: Urea Application
Definition: CO2 emissions from urea application.CO2

Name: Direct N2O Emissions from Managed Soils
Definition: DirectN2O emissions from managed soils from the synthetic N fertilizers application; organic N applied as fertilizer (e.g. animal manure, compost, sewage sludge, rendering waste); urine and dung N deposited on pasture, range and paddock by grazing animals; N in crop residues (above and below ground), including from N-fixing crops and from forages during pasture renewal; N mineralization/immobilization associated with loss/gain of soil organic matter resulting from change of land use or management of mineral soils; and drainage/management of organic soils (i.e., histosols). N2O

Name: Indirect N2O Emissions from Managed Soils
Definition: Indirect N2O emissions from: (1) the volatilization of N (as NH 3 and NOx) following the application of synthetic and organic N fertilizers and /or urine and dung deposition from grazing animals, and the subsequ ent deposition of the N as ammonium (NH 4+) and oxides of N (NOx) on soils and waters, and (2) the leaching and runoff of N from synthetic and organic N fertilizer additions, crop residues, mineralization /immobilization of N associated with loss/gain of soil C in mineral soils through land use change or management practices, and urine and dung deposition from grazing animals, into groundwater, riparian areas and wetlands, rivers and eventual ly the coastal ocean. N2O

Name: Indirect N2O Emissions from Manure Management
Definition: Indirect N2O emissions from manure management (activity data amount of nitrogen in the manure excreted). N2O

Name: Rice Cultivations
Definition: Methane (CH4) emissions from anaerobic decomposition of organic material in flooded rice fields. Any N2O emissions from the use of nitrogen-based fertilizers in rice cultivation should be reported under N emissions from managed soils. CH4

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Other sources of CH4 and N2O emissions on land. N2O, CH4

Name: Harvested Wood Products
Definition: CO2 net emissions or removals resulting from Harvest Wood Products. CO2

Name: WASTE
Definition: CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC, SO2

Name: Solid Waste Disposal
Definition: Methane is produced from anaerobic microbial decomposition of organic matter in solid waste disposal sites. Carbon dioxide (CO2) is also produced but CO2 from biogenic or organic waste sources is covered by the AFOLU Sector. Emissions of halogenated gases should be accounted in IPPU. Long-term storage of carbon in SWDS is reported as an information item. CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Managed Waste Disposal Sites
Definition: A managed solid waste disposal site must have controlled placement of waste (i.e. waste directed to specific deposition areas, a degree of control of scavenging and fires) and will include at least one of the following: cover material; mechanical compaction; or leveling of the waste. This category can be subdivided into aerobic and anaerobic. CH4 N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Unmanaged Waste Disposal Sites
Definition: These are all other solid waste disposal sites that do not fall into the above category. This category can be subdivided into deep and shallow. CH4 N2O, NOx, NMVOC

Name: Uncategorised Waste Disposal Sites
Definition: Mixture of above 4A1 and 4A2. Countries that do not have data on division of managed/unmanaged may use this category. CH4 N2O, NOx, NMVOC

Name: Biological Treatment of Solid Waste
Definition: Solid waste composting and other biological treatment. Emissions from biogas facilities (anaerobic digestion) with energy production are reported in the Energy Sector 1A4. CH4, N2O NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Incineration and Open Burning of Waste
Definition: Incineration of waste and open burning waste, not including waste-to-energy facilities. Emissions from waste burnt for energy are reported under the Energy Sector 1A. Emissions from the burning of agricultural wastes should be reported under AFOLU (3C1). All non-CO

Name: Waste Incineration
Definition: Combustion of solid wastes in controlled incineration facilities. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Open Burning of Waste
Definition: Combustion of waste in the open-air or in an open dump. CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Wastewater Treatment and Discharge
Definition: Methane is produced from anaerobic decomposition of organic matter by bacteria in sewage facilities and from food processing and other industrial facilities during wastewater treatment. N2O is also produced by bacteria (denitrification and nitrification) in wastewater treatment and discharge. CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Domestic Wastewater Treatment and Discharge
Definition: Treatment and discharge of liquid wastes and sludge from housing and commercial sources (including human waste) through: wastewater sewage systems, collection and treatment systems, open pits/latrines, anaerobic lagoons, anaerobic reactors and discharge into surface waters. Emissions from sludge disposed at SWDS are reported under category. CH4, N2O NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Industrial Wastewater Treatment and Discharge
Definition: Treatment and discharge of liquid wastes and sludge from industrial processes such as: fo od processing, textiles, or pulp and paper production. This includes anaerobic lagoons, anaerobic reactors, and discharge into surface waters. Industrial wastewater released into domestic wastewater sewage should be included under 4D1. CH4, N2O NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Release of GHGs from other waste handling activities than listed in categories 4A to 4D. 6D CO2, CH4, N2O, NOx, CO, NMVOC

Name: Indirect N2O Emissions from the Atmospheric Deposition of Nitrogen in NOx and NH3
Definition: Excluding indirect emissions from NOx and NH3 in agriculture which are reported in 3C5&3C6. N2O

Name: Other (please specify)
Definition: Only use this category exceptionally, for any categories than cannot be accommodated in the categories described above. Include a reference to where a detailed explanation of the category can be found.
